criteria: Ability to identify and differentiate between reliable and unreliable sources of information regarding healthy foods.
Understanding of the criteria that make a source reliable (e.g., scientific backing, expert consensus, peer review).
Practical application of identified resources to make informed decisions about healthy eating.
descriptions: Does not identify any resources or identifies only unreliable resources.
Identifies one reliable resource or multiple unreliable resources with no distinction made between them.
Identifies a mix of reliable and unreliable resources but struggles to differentiate between them effectively.
Identifies multiple reliable resources and attempts to explain the differences between reliable and unreliable resources with some inaccuracies.
Identifies multiple reliable resources and clearly articulates the differences between reliable and unreliable resources, providing detailed explanations and examples.
Demonstrates no understanding of the criteria for evaluating the reliability of a source.
Demonstrates minimal understanding of the criteria for evaluating the reliability of a source.
Demonstrates some understanding of the criteria for evaluating the reliability of a source but cannot consistently apply them.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of the criteria for evaluating the reliability of a source and can usually apply them.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the criteria for evaluating the reliability of a source and consistently applies them.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of the criteria for evaluating the reliability of a source, consistently applies them, and can explain the nuances and complexities involved.
Unable to use identified resources to inform healthy eating decisions.
Struggles to use identified resources to inform healthy eating decisions.
Can use identified resources to make simple healthy eating decisions with guidance.
Can use identified resources to make basic healthy eating decisions independently.
Can use identified resources to make well-informed healthy eating decisions, considering multiple factors.
Can use identified resources to make highly informed healthy eating decisions, demonstrating a deep understanding of nutritional principles and their application to real-world scenarios.
